subject: Management
title: The Manager's Real Job
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Manager's Real Job.

hook.text: Peter Drucker said a manager's job isn't to do work. It's to make work possible for others.

buildup.text: Many new managers keep doing individual contributor tasks because that's what earned them the role.

discovery.text: The shift to management means your output is now your team's output, not your own.

twist.text: The best individual contributor often makes the worst managerâ€”until they learn to let go.

climax.text: Your job is to remove blockers, provide clarity, and create space for others to excel.

punchline.text: Manage the work, not the doing.

quiz.question: According to Drucker, what is a manager's real job?
options: Doing the most important tasks personally
